revised_title: The Influence of Sulphonates on the Hydrolytic Activity of Sulphonic Acids
tldr: This study investigates the effect of sulphonates on the hydrolytic activity of sulphonic acids and their influence on the hydrolysis of cane sugar. The authors find that the presence of sulphonates affects the activity of the acid, with the potassium salt having a significant impact on the process. The results contribute to the ongoing discussion on the influence of neutral salts in chemical reactions.
